channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IA

item.title: Report E-2025010078
item.description:
Report E-2025010078

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-08T18:17:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-25
  • City: URBANDALE
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOLE TRANSPORT LLC DBA Solar transport
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver had 1 gallon of fuel left in hose while unloading shipment of fuel. When he unhooked the product hose the 1 gallon spilled onto the concrete. Spill was contained in his work area on the concrete around the fuel drops. Driver has spill kit on hand and was able to clean this up with absorbent pads.

item.title: Report E-2025010015
item.description:
Report E-2025010015

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-11
  • City: MASON CITY
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) quart of material released from one (1) 330-gallon plastic tote due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the tote cracking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents and dry acid to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010067
item.description:
Report E-2025010067

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-07
  • City: CEDAR RAPIDS
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CEDAR RAPIDS AND IOWA CITY RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: IAIS Carman found car leaking from the bottom. Under further inspection to bottom cap was left loose. CIC carman tightened cap which stopped the leak. Car was send back to Vantage Corn Processors for repairs. No update on the status of the car repairs has been sent to CIC.

item.title: Report E-2025010044
item.description:
Report E-2025010044

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-05
  • City: SHELBY
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1755ET, XPO-XCF notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 1 teaspoon of Saber herbicide released from plastic tote due to a loose cap The release impacted inside trailer#541-3112. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The cap will be resecured, waste consisting of oil dri and product gloves were containerized into (1) 5-gallon poly drum and left for terminal management to manage.
